intro.heading: Better content, less time
paragraphs: Most pubs do not need a content team. They need a repeatable way to capture what already happens in the pub and turn it into posts that sell a night.
I'll help you build a simple system: what to film, how to film it, what to say, and how to batch it so you stay consistent.
This is the same approach we use at The Anchor: authentic, simple, and focused on getting people through the door.

steps.title: Repeat what wins
steps.description: We keep the formats that drive bookings and drop the rest.

faqs.question: Do we need professional photos?
faqs.answer: No. For pubs, authentic phone content often performs better. I will show you how to capture it well.

faqs.question: Can staff do this without being on camera?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can film food, drinks, atmosphere, events, and behind-the-scenes without turning it into a performance.

faqs.question: How long does it take?
faqs.answer: Once the system is set up, you can batch a month of content in a short session instead of thinking about it daily.

faqs.question: Will the content look consistent?
faqs.answer: Yes. Templates and a simple style guide keep everything looking like the same pub, even when different people post.

faqs.question: What does it cost?
faqs.answer: £75 per hour plus VAT. Start with a short session to build the system, then add support if you want.
